posts.post_content:
1889 issue. SGC 30 grade. Nice centering and corners. Image is a little murky, but still very presentable. Typical glue/tape residue marks on the reverse from scrapbook mount.

[STRIKE]$235 delivered [/STRIKE] SOLD

or

will trade for these: William Barnie; Bill Bishop (Syracuse); Pete Connell; Frank Foreman; William Greenwood; Pete Hotaling (pose 236-2 right hand across waist, left hand across back); Fred Jevne; Sam Moffett; J.W. Nicholson; Tom Quinn; Sam Shaw; or Frank Zinn

emails to: [url]kkkkandp@aol.com[/url]
That card came from the Oregon Find.
Most likely, although I did not get the card from the original purchaser of that lot. The double mark was a pretty common back issue on those cards.

Yes, that adhesive pattern on the back of OJs was a common mark, especially for the cards of the Oregon find.  

I did a lot of data gathering when that find came out and the Earle card is definitely from that collection.  I can still remember picking up cards when they were fresh from the find. Wow, hard to think that it was 16 years ago.
